notes: Reproduced: SKManagedStream.OnReadManagedStream performs a single stream.Read() call without looping. When a stream returns fewer bytes than requested (valid per .NET Stream contract), Skia treats the short read as EOF and stops decoding. A 13MB PNG decoded through a ChunkedStream (max 2048 bytes per read) produces a 2000x2000 bitmap with zero pixel data — all rows are blank. With chunk sizes >= 4096 (matching Skia's internal read request size), decoding works because no short reads occur. This affects any .NET stream that returns partial reads: Azure Blob Storage, network streams, buffered streams crossing buffer boundaries. The reporter's scenario (Azure Blob with 4MB default chunk size) triggers when Skia's 4096-byte read request crosses a chunk boundary in the Azure buffer, causing a partial return. Duplicate of #1962. Bug exists on 3.116.0, 3.119.2, and main.

versionResults.notes: ChunkedStream with 2048-byte limit: 8 reads total, short read on request #8 (requested 4096, got 2048), Skia stops. Image 2000x2000 but all pixels blank.

errorMessages.primaryError: SKBitmap.Decode produces blank image when underlying stream returns partial reads (fewer bytes than requested). Skia's PNG codec makes 4096-byte read requests; a single short read causes Skia to treat the stream as ended, producing a bitmap with correct dimensions but zero pixel data.
